title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - Origin management for multi-region applications with Amazon CloudFront

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This session covers comprehensive origin management with Amazon CloudFront, including automatic failover with CloudFront and Route 53, granular origin routing using CloudFront Functions, and securing origins via S3 Origin Access Control and VPC private origins. It also examines hybrid integration through AWS Direct Connect and performance optimization with Origin Shield to reduce origin load.
bullets: Automatic failover mechanisms using CloudFront together with Route 53
Granular origin routing configured via CloudFront Functions
Origin security options: S3 with Origin Access Control (OAC) and VPC private origins
Integration of on-premises infrastructure using AWS Direct Connect for hybrid architectures
Use of Origin Shield to optimize cache performance and lower origin load
takeaways: Improve availability and resiliency by combining CloudFront failover with Route 53 for automatic traffic recovery
Gain fine-grained control over request routing to origins using CloudFront Functions for operational flexibility
Enhance origin security and access control with S3 OAC and VPC private origins to meet compliance needs
Enable hybrid deployments and preserve on-prem investments by integrating via AWS Direct Connect
Reduce origin load and improve cache efficiency by deploying Origin Shield

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG podcast hosts two audit leaders who explain how AI is already embedded in audit workflows, from transaction scoring and full-population analysis to conversational assistants and a real-time audit platform (KPMG Clara). They discuss client benefits, the shifting role and required competencies of auditors, implementation challenges, data security and regulatory concerns, and future risks and opportunities for AI in audit.
bullets: AI tools (e.g., Transaction Scoring, Clara AI) enable analysis of entire populations rather than sampling.
KPMG Clara provides real-time audit management and Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI supports documentation, disclosure analysis, and specialized agent workflows.
Adoption shifts auditor roles and demands new competencies and adaptation.
Key implementation issues include data security, regulatory environment, and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Prepare data access and quality so auditors can perform full-population analyses rather than sample-based checks.
Expect more continuous and real-time audit interactions—plan integrations or secure channels for platforms like KPMG Clara.
Prioritize data security, logging, and compliance controls to address regulatory and AI-specific risks during audits.
Anticipate auditors requiring different skills and closer collaboration with IT/ops teams to support AI-driven audit processes.

items.title: AI at Speed: From Investment to Performance

ai.summary: Based on the available description… At Davos 2026 PwC US Senior Partner and CEO Paul Griggs spoke with CNBC’s Emma Crosby about how organizations are shifting from AI exploration to execution, assessing initiatives through investment discipline, performance, and measurable value. They discuss leaders moving early, placing capital with intent, and designing operating models that preserve resilience without sacrificing performance while delivering measurable outcomes today and enabling future transformation.
bullets: AI adoption is moving from exploration to execution, evaluated by investment discipline and measurable value.
Leading organizations move early and allocate capital with clear intent.
Operating models are being designed to remain resilient while maintaining performance.
AI is delivering measurable outcomes today and supporting longer-term transformation.
Conversation framed at Davos 2026 between PwC US (Paul Griggs) and CNBC (Emma Crosby).
takeaways: Prioritize AI investments with clear performance metrics and measurable value to guide capital allocation.
Act early—timely investment can be a differentiator when moving from exploration to execution.
Design operating models that balance resilience and performance to support AI-driven workloads.
Require demonstrable, measurable outcomes from AI pilots to inform longer-term infrastructure and investment decisions.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Copilot provides real-time visual support for home projects and repairs by seeing what you see and offering step-by-step instructions. The video highlights examples like leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines, emphasizing clear, actionable guidance.
bullets: Real-time visual assistance: Copilot can view your problem and respond.
Step-by-step repair instructions for home projects and fixes.
Examples given: leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines.
Focus on clear, actionable guidance to help users complete repairs.
Designed to support troubleshooting and DIY maintenance.
takeaways: Remote visual troubleshooting capability could reduce immediate on-site technician dispatch for routine issues.
Step-by-step guidance can help standardize repairs and lower the risk of human error during maintenance.
Real-time instructions may shorten mean time to repair for common faults, improving operational availability.
Can be used as a training and documentation aid for less-experienced staff or external contractors.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer - Launching January 22!

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield launches worldwide on January 22 and prominently features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The title is a 3D real-time strategy RPG and the trailer footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Worldwide launch date: January 22.
Features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Game type: 3D real-time strategy RPG (player is the Endministrator of Endfield Industries).
Trailer capture: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Official links and social channels listed for Arknights: Endfield and NVIDIA GeForce.
takeaways: DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation is a highlighted feature—testbeds should include GPUs that support DLSS 4 for compatibility verification.
Trailer capture used an RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings, indicating high GPU compute and display-resolution requirements for reproducing similar content.
Plan release-date-aligned validation and performance testing around January 22 to evaluate DLSS 4 behavior under real-world workloads.
Ensure pipeline and tooling can handle 4K capture and DLSS 4 modes if supporting content production or benchmarking for this title.

items.title: I Travel The World And Live Rent-Free By Pet Sitting Full Time

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Charly Stoever, a 35-year-old financial coach, lives rent-free in Portland by pet sitting full time. The profile says she spent the last 18 months living out of two suitcases while bringing in $60,000 a year; the piece is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
bullets: Charly Stoever, 35, is a financial coach.
She lives rent-free in Portland by pet sitting full time.
She lived out of two suitcases for the last 18 months.
Her pet-sitting work brought in $60,000 a year.
This story is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
takeaways: Profile highlights mobile, low-footprint living (two suitcases) that can affect local short-term demand for power and connectivity at host residences.
Earning $60,000 annually from a nontraditional, location-flexible gig indicates segments of the population may rely less on permanent housing energy consumption.
Reliance on host properties (rent-free arrangements) suggests more transient occupancy patterns that could influence distributed residential load profiles.
Content focused on millennial money and alternative work models underscores the importance of accounting for diverse lifestyle-driven demand patterns in planning.

items.title: How I earn $900,000 a year as a dermatologist

bullets: Dr. Anna Chacon, 39, is a dermatologist in Miami, FL.
She operates her own private practice.
Estimated net worth: about $6 million.
$3.2M of that is investments.
She owns a $1.9M home and a $1.1M office building.
takeaways: Private-practice physicians who own office buildings can be stakeholders in local commercial power and connectivity needs—consider outreach about resilient power or edge services.
Ownership of commercial real estate suggests potential sites for small-scale colocation or edge deployments tailored to medical offices.
High-net-worth individuals with mixed investment and property portfolios may value secure, reliable infrastructure—highlight reliability and disaster resilience in offerings.
Miami location underscores the importance of climate and hurricane resilience in grid and data-center planning for local clients.

ai.summary: Based on the available description… A giant bubble of carbon dioxide can store 20 megawatts of energy. These new batteries are presented as a solution to renewable energy fluctuations and to help power the global shift to clean energy.
bullets: A CO2-based storage system is described as holding 20 megawatts of energy.
Characterized as a 'giant bubble' of carbon dioxide.
Presented as a type of new battery technology.
Framed as addressing variability in renewable energy supply.
Positioned to support the global transition to clean energy.
takeaways: 20 MW storage capacity suggests potential for utility-scale applications.
Could help grid operators mitigate renewable generation variability.
May be relevant for planners seeking low-carbon storage options for decarbonization efforts.

items.title: AI w cenach transferowych – jak wykorzystać jej potencjał? | Monika Palmowska, Jakub Roszkiewicz

ai.summary: Based on the available description… The KPMG ON AIR podcast episode discusses how AI is already changing transfer pricing work—used for monitoring profitability, comparative analyses and automating TP documentation—and emphasizes that AI will strengthen rather than replace tax advisors. The conversation also covers implementation guidance (start with process organization), integration with ERP and intelligent benchmarks, secure environments like Digital Gateway, and risks including data security, RODO and hallucinations.
bullets: AI applications: monitoring rentowności, benchmarking and automation of transfer pricing documentation.
AI augments tax advisors’ work and supports development of junior staff rather than replacing experts.
Key risks highlighted: data protection, security and AI 'hallucinations' (incorrect outputs).
Secure setups (Digital Gateway) and compliance with RODO are essential for safe AI use.
Implementation advice: integrate AI with ERP/intelligent benchmarks and start by organizing processes.
takeaways: Prioritize data security and GDPR/RODO compliance when enabling AI workflows for financial/tax data.
Provide or adopt secure environments (like Digital Gateway) to control access and reduce leakage risks.
Ensure ERP and benchmark data are integration-ready to unlock AI-driven monitoring and automation.
Plan for change management: AI will augment staff roles and require upskilling, not wholesale replacement.
Start AI projects by cleaning and structuring processes/data — this is the foundation for reliable outputs.

items.title: Stack small wins with Microsoft Copilot

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video presents Microsoft Copilot as a way to keep momentum when tackling workouts, projects, or personal goals. It encourages stacking small wins with Copilot to maintain progress and motivation.
bullets: Highlights using Copilot to maintain momentum across workouts, projects, and personal goals.
Emphasizes stacking small wins rather than big, one-time efforts.
Positions Copilot as a productivity and motivation aid.
Short, broad encouragement to integrate Copilot into daily routines.
takeaways: So what: Decision-makers can view Copilot as a tool to help teams sustain progress on operational projects and maintenance workflows.
So what: Breaking initiatives into small, trackable wins with Copilot may improve follow-through on long-term infrastructure work.
So what: Encouraging incremental progress can support timeline adherence and team morale during complex rollouts.
So what: Integrating Copilot into routine tasks could aid continuity for shift-based or distributed data center teams.
